page.title: 10CHURCHES WELBURY & DEIGHTON
page.content: Welbury church,St.Leonards,is built on the highest point of the village.Though medieval in origin it was heavily restored in 1887 by Hicks.The building is used regularly by a small congregation but most villagers think it important to have a church. The incumbent,Mr.George Davies, is also Rector of East & West Rounton. A Congregational Chapel was started in two cottages in 1843 but this is now a private house. Apart from the Church of England members of all denominations travel elsewhere to worship. A Sunday School is held in the Village Hall for young children of the Parish.At Christmas the children perform a Nativity play in the church for the villagers. All Saints,Deighton is another medieval church restored by Hicks in 1901.It is now administered with St.Thomas's in Brompton.
